Yvaine

Download free pattern! View on Ravelry

Yvaine is a triangular shawl, which is knit from the top to the bottom point with increases on every right side row. I was able to knit the shawl using the row combinations below using one ball of Handmaiden Fine Yarns Casbah Sock.

It’s a very simple construction: garter stitch border, 3 panels of seed stitch, and ending in garter stitch. I suppose you could just use garter stitch throughout, but I opted for seed stitch to give it a slightly more subtle texture than garter stitch usually provides. I blocked my shawl, and it nearly doubled in size. Blocking is, of course, optional with a project like this, but I’d recommend it.

This is a great portable project. It was one of those things I could just put down and do whatever, whenever. I finished it rather quickly, considering its size. Finished measurements after block were 45″ wingspan, and 20″ from cast on edge to bottom tip.

This shawl is named after Yvaine, the star from Neil Gaiman’s novel Stardust. I felt it was an appropriate name for the pattern.

Pattern Information

Gauge

16 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette stitch, after blocking

Yardage

350 - 355 yards Fingering / 4 ply (14 wpi)

Yarns

Handmaiden Fine Yarn Casbah Sock (Fingering)

Needles

US 8 - 5.0 mm

Sizes

one size

About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
